blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin, which would be a grave offense against God?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in my personal and professional relationships
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence how I treat others in my personal and professional relationships?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make wealth, possessions, and material comforts a dominant force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

due to your own stress , time constraints , or competing priorities in balancing work - life responsibilities as a parent and partner
in balancing work - life responsibilities as a parent and partner
oppression.question:
Have I mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others? 

(Consider the scenario where you may have unintentionally acted with unjust bias, disrespect, or condescension towards others due to your own stress, time constraints, or competing priorities in balancing work-life responsibilities as a parent and partner.)
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Did you mistreat others through your actions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Have you taken for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the many blessings in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence, believing instead that my own efforts were solely responsible for their realization?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others, including friends and family members, with vulgar or inappropriate language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Have I overindulged in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: for something that could have been done on another day
impiety.question: Did you use your Sunday for something that could have been done on another day, thus failing to give God the rest and reverence due to him?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my thoughts rather than seeking reconciliation, especially when conflicts arise with those close to me?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

impurity.question: Did I use practices, substances, or objects intended to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

impurity.question: Did you use certain practices to avoid conception in any intimate relationship?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.
